newsitem.title: TAIWAN: PRESS DIGEST - Taiwan newspapers - September 16.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - Taiwan newspapers - September 16.

text.p: These are the leading stories in Taiwan's press on Monday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
CHINA TIMES - Taiwan issues sea warning for Typhoon Violet.
Northern Taoyuan oil refinery faces shutdown.
Some 100,000 elder citizens who have savings of T$1 million or more will no longer be able to get monthly allowance from government.
UNITED DAILY NEWS - Economics ministry to revise rules governing industry upgrades in bid to boost investment.
Taiwan people join protest in Hong Kong, vowing to protect disputed Diaoyu islands.
COMMERCIAL TIMES - Communications ministers from both sides of Taiwan strait reach tacit agreement on direct links in United States in 1995.
Vice ministers from Taiwan and United States open economic dialogue.
ECONOMIC DAILY NEWS - Government plans to toughten supervision on local credit unions.
Taiwan completes draft regulation on margin trading in over-the-counter market.
